sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of UV-Visible Spectrophotometer for qualitative identification and quantitative determination of pharmaceutical compounds based on their absorbance characteristics in ultraviolet and visible regions.
sections.scope: Applicable to UV-Visible spectroscopy activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Ensure the instrument is placed on a stable surface away from direct sunlight.
Power ON the UV-Visible spectrophotometer and allow the lamp to warm up for at least 30 minutes.
Initialize the control software and verify that the instrument passes self-diagnostics.
Perform wavelength calibration using standard filters or holmium oxide solution.
Perform baseline correction by running a blank scan with empty cuvette holder or air.
Select the measurement mode (single wavelength, scan, or kinetics) as per requirement.
Set the wavelength or wavelength range for analysis.
Prepare blank solution using the same solvent as used for sample preparation.
Select appropriate cuvettes (quartz for UV range, glass for visible range) with matched path length.
Rinse cuvettes with the solvent and then with blank solution.
Fill the cuvette with blank solution ensuring no air bubbles are present.
Place the blank cuvette in the reference position and acquire blank spectrum.
Set the instrument to zero absorbance or 100% transmittance with blank.
Prepare sample and standard solutions in appropriate concentrations.
Rinse the sample cuvette with a small portion of sample solution.
Fill the cuvette with sample solution and wipe the outer surfaces clean.
Place the sample cuvette in the sample holder and close the lid.
Acquire the spectrum or absorbance reading at specified wavelength.
Record the absorbance values and wavelength information.
For quantitative analysis, prepare calibration curve using standard solutions.
Calculate concentration of unknown samples using the calibration curve or Beer's law.
After measurements, clean cuvettes thoroughly with appropriate solvents and dry.
Document all spectral data, wavelengths, and calculations in the analytical record.
precautions: Use quartz cuvettes for UV measurements (below 340 nm) as glass absorbs UV light.
Ensure cuvettes are clean, dry, and free from scratches or fingerprints.
Handle cuvettes by frosted sides or top edges only.
Prepare samples in appropriate concentration range to maintain absorbance between 0.2-0.8 for accuracy.
Use freshly prepared solutions and avoid photosensitive samples exposed to light.
Ensure blank and sample solutions are at the same temperature.
Remove air bubbles from cuvettes as they interfere with measurements.
Clean spills immediately to prevent damage to the sample compartment.
Perform regular wavelength calibration to maintain accuracy.
Wear appropriate PPE when handling samples and solvents.
